Body: I own a Samsung Galaxy S III (rooted).My phone recently fell out of my car and was ran over multiple times before I could recover it.  The phone still works. I can turn it off and on (sound and vibrate work) but the screen is completely useless.  The back and the settings key both light up when I press the home key, but they do nothing and I can see nothing on the entire screen.What I want to know is, I have business texts on my phone that I need to save. Is there a way to pull (or copy) the messages from my phone to my computer?P.S.  I attempted using Wondershare Dr.Fone, but it will not work as I need to allow the application superuser access via the phone, which I cannot do because the screen does not work.I am unsure whether the USB debugging is on or off. I have been looking at other questions related to this one, but most of them involve the touch aspect of the screen still workingThank you all in advance.
Title: How to copy SMS messages to computer with phone screen broken

history.Text: I own a Samsung Galaxy S III (rooted).My phone recently "fell" out of my car and was ran over multiple times before I could recover it.  The phone still works-- I can turn it off and on (sound and vibrate work) but the screen is completely useless.  The back and the settings key both light up, but do nothing, and I can see nothing on the entire screen.What I want to know is, I have business texts on my phone that I need to save-- is there anyway to pull the messages from my phone to my computer?P.S.  I attempted using Wondershare Dr.Fone, but it will not work as I need to allow the application superuser access via the phone, which I cannot do because the screen does not work.Thank you all in advance,Me
How to put SMS messages on computer without a phone screen

I own a Samsung Galaxy S III (rooted).My phone recently "fell" out of my car and was ran over multiple times before I could recover it.  The phone still works-- I can turn it off and on (sound and vibrate work) but the screen is completely useless.  The back and the settings key both light up, but do nothing, and I can see nothing on the entire screen.What I want to know is, I have business texts on my phone that I need to save-- is there anyway to pull the messages from my phone to my computer?P.S.  I attempted using Wondershare Dr.Fone, but it will not work as I need to allow the application superuser access via the phone, which I cannot do because the screen does not work.Thank you all in advance,MeEdit 1: P.S. None of the touch buttons work, including the back and the settings buttons (those only light up when pressing the home key)Edit 2:P.P.S. I am unsure whether the USB debugging is on or off. I have been looking at other questions related to this one, but most of them involve the touch aspect of the screen still working

history.Comment: Incorporated the P.S and P.P.S edits to the question body to formalize it.
